summary: The City Council of Chicago has authorized the Department of Planning and Development to fund a marketing program for businesses, developers, and investors in Priority Corridors, with funding not exceeding $100,000 per corridor until December 31, 2025. The Local Initiatives Support Corporation is designated to partner with the City on the program, with total compensation not exceeding $1,400,000. The ordinance includes Exhibit A, listing the Priority Corridors, and Exhibit B, detailing the work responsibilities of the Project Manager.
